newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Sun Hung Kai Properties boosts land bank.
newsitem.headline: Sun Hung Kai Properties boosts land bank.

text.p: Sun Hung Kai Properties Ltd said on Thursday it had added eight sites to its land bank since the start of the current financial year which had attributable gross floor area of 3.8 million square feet.

The property developer said in a statement that its land bank in Hong Kong consisted of 47.8 million square feet of attributable gross floor area, consisting of 15.1 million square feet of completed investment properties and 32.7 million square feet of properties under development.
"The group continues to expand its investment property portfolio, with an emphasis on the development of large-scale, high quality commercial complexes," it said in a statement.
It said it would complete more than three million square feet of new investment properties in the next three years.

"Satisfactory growth in rental income is expected in coming years due to continuing positive rental reversion from the group's existing properties and additional contributions from new investment properties to be completed," it said.
Sun Hung Kai Properties said the completion of its infrastructure projects would strengthen its cash flow and enhance recurrent income.
"The group continues to adopt a prudent and selective policy in China, with investments not exceeding 10 percent of the group's total assets," the company said.
Sun Hung Kai Properties earlier announced a 21 percent rise in interim net profit to HK$6.25 billion.
